meanings.definition: To reach or extend beyond a certain point.
meanings.sent1: I tried to jump and overreach the fence, but I couldn't make it.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes when I play tag, I overreach and end up falling down.
meanings.sent3: During the game of hide and seek, I decided to overreach and hide in the neighbor's yard.
meanings.sent4: Her ambition to overreach the stars led her to dream big and work hard.
meanings.sent5: The tree's branches seemed to overreach towards the sky, reaching for the sun.

meanings.definition: To try to do too much or go too far.
meanings.sent1: I tend to overreach when I take on too many tasks at once.
meanings.sent2: She knew she had to be careful not to overreach and exhaust herself.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to overreach and cook ten different dishes for the party.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm to overreach in the project made him overlook the small details.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's attempt to overreach in the race caused him to lose his balance.

meanings.definition: To defeat oneself by going too far.
meanings.sent1: In the debate, he tended to overreach and make weak arguments.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to overreach and risk losing the game by being too aggressive.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke started to overreach and became awkwardly long.
meanings.sent4: The company's decision to overreach in their expansion plans led to financial troubles.
meanings.sent5: His desire to overreach in negotiations ended up costing him the deal.
